subject: Re: Jillian Dinkel Website – Visual Audit
preview: Hi All,  Excited to hear and see that the website changes went live in December.  jillian@jilliandinkel.com you'll have access to WolfIQ for support complimentary through to June 22nd. From June 23rd,

full_threads.body:
Hi All,
Excited to hear and see that the website changes went live in December.
jillian@jilliandinkel.com you'll have access to WolfIQ for support complimentary through to June 22nd. From June 23rd, it is up to you to continue on with their support plan or not, we'll leave that in your hands.All contacts for WolfIQ are CC'd in this email, but for any new support tasks we recommend emailing: support@wolfiq.com.au
We wish you all the best for 2026.

Kindest,
Amy

Bandit business hours are Tuesday-Friday 8:30am-5pm.Holiday closure: The studio will be closed Friday 19th, and will reopen Tuesday 6th of Jan.



Amy Hauber

Account Director

+ 61 466 844 555

Suite 1, Level 2, 105 Crown Street,
Darlinghurst NSW 2010
@banditdesigngroup

http://banditdesigngroup.com.au/

of the land in which we work and pay our respects to their Elders,
past, present and future.

Great thank you!

JILLIAN DINKEL

CREATIVE DIRECTOR & PRINCIPAL

94 Cathedral Street, Woolloomooloo NSW 2011

P: (02) 8033 5429

Hi Jillian,

I hope you’re doing well.

Just confirming that your website is now live: https://jilliandinkel.com/

We’re currently completing the post-launch checks and final updates, and we’ll keep you updated as we work through these over the week. If you happen to notice anything at all in the meantime or have any questions, please don’t hesitate to let us know. We’re very happy to take a look.

Thanks again, and congratulations on the launch!

Thanks Jillian.

We will get this done and confirm.

Hi team,

I'm signing off but to clarify- let's go live and I'm fine with option 2 (taking longer, preserving data)

JILLIAN DINKEL

Hi Jillian,

Thanks for updating the credentials.

We’re now able to access everything and are ready to proceed with the go-live.

For the launch, we have two options and are happy to proceed with whichever you prefer:
  • Option 1 (recommended): We copy the staging site (https://jilliandinkelcom.wolfiq.cloud/) and replace jilliandinkel.com. This is the quickest approach. It will overwrite the existing form entries; however, we can export the current entries beforehand and re-add any missing pages or posts if needed.
  • Option 2: We manually apply the changes from the staging site to the live site. This will preserve the existing data, but it will take a bit longer.

Please let us know which option you’d like to proceed with, and we’ll keep you posted once it’s completed.

Also, which email address would you like us to use for the monthly reports?

Thanks again,

I've just changed the password. Can you try again?
Kind Regards,

JILLIAN DINKEL

CREATIVE DIRECTOR & PRINCIPAL

94 Cathedral Street, Woolloomooloo NSW 2011

P: (02) 8033 5429

It looks like the FTP details provided aren’t quite correct, as we’re unable to connect at the moment. When you have a chance, could you please double-check and resend them?

Thanks again, and we’ll jump straight back in once everything’s sorted.

Hi Jillian,

Thanks so much for checking in.

Yes, we’ll just need a new FTP user with full/root access to the site files. We weren’t able to access the core WordPress files with the current credentials, so this will
help ensure everything runs smoothly during and after go-live.

We weren’t able to access the core files using the wolfiq@jilliandinkel.com details, which is why we’re requesting a new FTP user with full access.

If helpful, here are the steps to create this in GreenGeeks Greengeeks FTP Access Guide:
  1. Log in to your GreenGeeks cPanel
  2. Go to FTP Accounts
  3. Create a new FTP account
  4. For the Directory, set it to the root of the site (usually public_html  or leave it blank for full access)
  5. Save the account details
  6. Add the new FTP credentials to this document:
    https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CKOEBiuxu3m2ZiQwZPSXt5fYw7JJeaqu5uVYJp21btY/edit

Alternatively, you’re also very welcome to share cPanel access instead, if that’s easier.

Once that’s sorted, we’ll be all set to move things along smoothly. Thanks again for your help, and please feel free to reach out if anything’s unclear or if you’d like us to double-check anything at all.

Warmly,

Do you mean just doing the same thing again- a new FTP? Did you get the wolfiq@jilliandinkel.com details?

JILLIAN DINKEL

Hi Jillian,

Thanks so much for confirming. We’ve now applied the requested updates to the staging site.

You can review them here when you have a moment:
https://jilliandinkel.wolfiq.cloud/

While checking the FTP details, we found that the current credentials are working, but we’re unable to access the core files. To help ensure everything runs smoothly, especially if anything needs attention during or after go-live, would you mind generating new FTP details or providing cPanel access and adding them here?
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CKOEBiuxu3m2ZiQwZPSXt5fYw7JJeaqu5uVYJp21btY/edit?tab=t.0

Once that’s sorted, we’ll be all set to move things along smoothly.

Thanks again for your help, and please feel free to let us know if you have any questions or if there’s anything else you’d like us to check..

Hi Jillian and Amy,

Thanks for sending this through.

We’re currently working on this and will share an update with you asap.

Thanks so much!

Hi @wolfiq Joel

Some of the list above is just to confirm with Bandit the adjustments that were requested for the site.
I made the following updates based on their conversation:

  1. Updated the mobile banner with the attached image – Done
  2. Adjusted the Contact Page by adding more space at the top to create breathing room from the header – Done
  3. Project Pages Navigation (“Prev” and “Next”) is now reflected on the middle image for both the Homepage and Single Project Pages – Done

Please help verify and double-check if I missed anything beyond the items listed above.

(Time: 20mins)

-LJ

Thank you for confirming. projects@wolfiq.com.au please let us know once those remaining items are actioned please.

Thank you Amy,

I would prefer the carousel navigation to appear whenever the user's cursor is within that block, including over the central image.

Thank you for confirming flodesk and the hero image

I'm fine with the mobile spacing if this is what you recommend.

Once these are resolved, please go live.

Thanks all

JILLIAN DINKEL

Hey Jillian,

Please see below responses in purple:

2. Project Pages- carousel navigation not always showing up for me- two screenshots here. As the images are dark and the button font is very fine, we need the navigation to show up in the white space within this banner (as in first image) to ensure good UX

Can this indicator not come up immediately within the carousel? It's not immediately clear that you can actually scroll for more images, especially since you're always seeing three whole images. I have done a loom to explain. I'm fine for it to say 'next' on the central image
When the user interacts with the carousel the next and previous appear straight away - see recording here. If the text appears over the central image you'll have the same issue where the text will blend into the image.

5. Is the contact form/ newsletter attached to the correct Flodesk workflows? you should be getting a fairly instant flodesk email response from entering these- I have done so but don't think I have an email address that isn't already attached. Have you gotten responses from your testing? Which also calls to mind, does the form allow you to just put the project enquiry submissions to the Flodesk workflow? The press or careers entries do not need the same workflow response.
Thank you for sending through the automation for the project enquiry workflow. That looks to be working as it should. However, did you get a response for the newsletter sign up? That should be immediate as well. Can you confirm the press/careers enquiries do not get put into this workflow?
Yes, have forwarded this over to you.
Confirming press and careers do not go into this workflow

6. Mobile: The hero image on mobile only seems to have a greyed out filter on it.
This hasn't changed. The other images on the site have the same vibrancy as the desktop version. Also the spacing has changed on this page, there is now a lot more white space on mobile before the image starts. I prefer to keep the spacing as per the current mobile site.

It appears because the file you supplied was 70mb it was being compressed to get down to a web res version. We've attached a smaller version projects@wolfiq.com.au can you please use the one attached for mobile only. Let us know when actioned.

In terms of spacing - I've included screenshots below - this is our preferred spacing for mobile homepage now that it's a still image as the padding is evenly spaced. The transition is different from the live site so it is not exactly the same spacing as the current site.

Lastly, I have noticed on desktop the spacing has changed on the contact page- it's missing some space at the top (see current site to compare) It needs a bit more breathing room from the header to the start of the Expressions of Interest- to align with the current site spacing
projects@wolfiq.com.au can you please add the correct padding on the contact page under the navigation pls

Staging:



Live:

Kindest,
Amy

Hi Amy,

Were these items checked on Bandit's end/devices? I've checked the items on the device I have available (15" MacBook air) and it seems most of the items are still an issue or haven't been confirmed. I have included notes on the relevant items here:

2. Project Pages- carousel navigation not always showing up for me- two screenshots here. As the images are dark and the button font is very fine, we need the navigation to show up in the white space within this banner (as in first image) to ensure good UX

Can this indicator not come up immediately within the carousel? It's not immediately clear that you can actually scroll for more images, especially since you're always seeing three whole images. I have done a loom to explain. I'm fine for it to say 'next' on the central image:

Videos | Library | Loom - 18 December 2025 - Watch Video

5. Is the contact form/ newsletter attached to the correct Flodesk workflows? you should be getting a fairly instant flodesk email response from entering these- I have done so but don't think I have an email address that isn't already attached. Have you gotten responses from your testing? Which also calls to mind, does the form allow you to just put the project enquiry submissions to the Flodesk workflow? The press or careers entries do not need the same workflow response.

Thank you for sending through the automation for the project enquiry workflow. That looks to be working as it should. However, did you get a response for the newsletter sign up? That should be immediate as well. Can you confirm the press/careers enquiries do not get put into this workflow?

6. Mobile: The hero image on mobile only seems to have a greyed out filter on it.

This hasn't changed. The other images on the site have the same vibrancy as the desktop version. Also the spacing has changed on this page, there is now a lot more white space on mobile before the image starts. I prefer to keep the spacing as per the current mobile site. Screenshots:





Lastly, I have noticed on desktop the spacing has changed on the contact page- it's missing some space at the top (see current site to compare) It needs a bit more breathing room from the header to the start of the Expressions of Interest- to align with the current site spacing.


Kind Regards,
